definition: to change positions/to shift one's ground
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: It may be possible, then, to bring about a change in the US position.
sentences.chinese: 因此，美国转变立场的可能性还是存在的。

sentences.english: So many have taken the choice to switch sides in order to live.
sentences.chinese: 如此多的人选择转变立场为了生存。

sentences.english: The shift among black Democrats was dramatic.
sentences.chinese: 这说明黑人民主党人大大转变立场。

definition: to change sides in a war/turncoat
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
hawk faction (opposite: 鸽派, doves)/fierce and combative party/war party/warmongers
